commitResults.messageTitle: add level-1 minimal skeleton features - greet, echo, exit
add level-2 minimum skeleton features - add, list
add level-3 minimum skeleton features - mark as done
add level-4 minimum skeleton features - todos, events, deadlines
add input/output redirection technique to semiautomate testing of Duke
add error handling - made new DukeException class
reconfigured ENUM for Actions, and added counter in the delete message which I forgot to add in Level-6

commitResults.messageBody:
The tasks entered are now saved automatically whenever the task
list changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add parsing of Date type and format date
commitResults.messageBody:
Dates for deadline/ event are now accepted in 'yyyy-mm-dd'
format, and printed in 'MMM dd yyyy' format with error handling
The Ui class abstracts away print messages to the user
The Storage class abstracts away save and loading of tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Parser and Command classes for OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser and Command abstract away the interpretation of
user commands.

Use Ui, Storage, Parser, TaskList, Task, and DukeException
classes and their children to abstract away details
and follow the OOP paradigm.
Put all classes into packages.
Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.
Add JavaDoc comments to the program

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with coding standard
commitResults.messageBody: Ensure that any new code is compliant.

commitResults.messageTitle: Automate project builds using Gradle - run, build
commitResults.messageBody: Set up Gradle to build and run Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI to Duke with JavaFX and fxml
Update GUI to separate display picture from text
Fix bug in saving newly added tasks, add greeting

commitResults.messageBody:
Keyword to find command is case sensitive.

A case insentive find is more user-friendly because
users cannot be expected to remember the exact case
of the keywords.

Let's update the keyword search algorithm to be case
insensitive.

No assert statements.

Assert statements help document assumptions that should hold true.

Method to create file was not extracted.

This causes the code in Duke getResponse to be less readable.

Lets abstract away the details to create file if file does not
already exist.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make happy path prominent for method getResponse
commitResults.messageBody:
Happy path in method getResponse is not prominent.

The code will be less readable because of possible distraction.

Lets make the happy path more prominent to improve readability.

Parse method has lower level details on implementation.

This reduces readability.

Lets abstract the details into new methods for so that the parse
method will only have step-by-step instructions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract method from methods in Storage
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods saveTasks and loadSavedTasks have lower level details.

This reduces readability.

Lets abstract these details into new methods.

createTask method in Task class has low level implementation
details.

This reduces readability.

Lets abstract away the details into methods so that the code is
more readable.

Deadlines and events cannot be sorted by their date.

This hinders usability, especially since if users want to know
what is the nearest deadline or event.

Let's make the tasks comparable to sort them according to their
date.
